intro: Clidemia pubescens, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silverleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Clidemia pubescens is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it an invasive species in some areas.
